alert.note: Alert for Northern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 19 at 3:22AM PST until December 19 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches. * WHERE...Northern Oregon Cascades, mainly north of Santiam Canyon. * WHEN...Until noon PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will be lowest near the Columbia Gorge. Meanwhile, snow levels will generally remain above 5000 feet south of Santiam Canyon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions visit https://www.tripcheck.com or https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map or by calling 5 1 1
